Card-1.title: Linux CLI FYAM
Card-1.imgAlt: Wiki formatted links with a penguin in top left corner.
Card-1.text: An online book for linux command lines. Good reference material.

Card-2.title: Wikibooks: Bash shell scripting
Card-2.imgAlt: Picture of wikibooks logo top left, with wiki formatted links.
Card-2.text: Another online book for Bash. Good reference material.

Card-3.title: Ryan's Linux Cheetsheet
Card-3.imgAlt: Screenshot of landing page for Ryan's cheatsheet.
Card-3.text: A cheetsheet with many useful commands. Also has other resources.

Card-4.title: Explain Shell
Card-4.imgAlt: Landing page of explainshell.com, with website logo header and a search box.
Card-4.text: Extremely useful for deciphering scripts and commands bit by bit. Recommended.

Card-5.title: Freecodecamp: Zsh
Card-5.imgAlt: Screen shot of the beginning of the article; shows an example of a terminal window.
Card-5.text: A quick walkthrough on the basics of installing and setting up Zsh.

Card-6.title: The Odin Project: CLI Basics
Card-6.imgAlt: Beginning of the lesson for the CLI basics; has odin logo top left, and sidebar for current progress.
Card-6.text: A step by step guide on the very basics of the CLI. Lots of other helpful links included inside.
